title: Setup
description: In this video, I outline what you need setup and ready before you begin the course Working with Data and APIs in JavaScript.

links.title: Node.js
links.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime which allows you to run JavaScript code on your computer.

links.title: Visual Studio Code
links.description: Visual Studio Code is a code editor with support for development operations like debugging, task running, and version control.

links.title: Atom
links.description: Atom is a free and open-source text and source code editor with support for plug-ins, and embedded Git Control.

links.title: Brackets
links.description: Brackets is a source code editor with a primary focus on web development.

links.title: Sublime Text
links.description: Sublime Text is a shareware cross-platform source code editor.

links.title: CodePen
links.description: CodePen is a online development environment for front-end designers and developers.

links.title: JSFiddle
links.description: JSFiddle is an online IDE service for testing and showcasing code snippets.

links.title: p5.js Web Editor
links.description: p5 Editor is an online code editor to create and share p5.js sketches.

links.title: Live Server
links.description: Live Server extension for VS Code

links.title: iTerm
links.description: iTerm is a replacement for Terminal for MacOS.

links.title: Git Bash
links.description: Git Bash is a terminal application for Windows environments which provides a Git/Linux command line experience.

links.title: Git and GitHub for Poets
links.description: Coding Train track on working with Git (version control) and GitHub
